reviews.review_msg: Amazing professor, tough class for sure, but taught well

Great teacher who is able to get the student's struggles and perspectives, great at the explaining and has practical knowledge of CAS (was Maple developer as grad student). Homework is closely related to lecture and his notes are sufficient without needing to Google. Even as an engineering major I found this class interesting and engaging.

Dr. Monagan is a responsible instructor and he did deliver the course content in a clear way. Office hours were always helpful. Study the lectures, do the bi-weekly homework, and you'll be alright doing the take-home final.
Very approachable professor. His teaching style is very structured and organized. Talks more about details and examples than the big picture.

He was an alright prof. One of my first profs that actually cared about you. Assignments and final are long and tough, so be prepared for a lot of work. You'll learn a lot of interesting stuff. Make sure you have a good understanding of algebra and coding before taking this class.

Assignments were extremely important(10% X 6 = 60%),and the take-home final was based on what you did on your assignments. Therefore, start your assignments as early as you can.When you get stuck, go to his office and he is always  willing to help. Don't expect you will get an easy high grade, as this is a 400 level course.

He won't scale our marks so you get what you did on assignments and midterms. Class notes are quite tedious and lots of writing which is totally avoidable. Instead of proving theorems, I would rather have Maple in front of me and go over sample question related to assignments during class. I would say.. his class is extremely boring and not helpful

Brilliant prof! Gives incredible lectures that are well worth your time.  Assignments are long but very much worth doing as you learn alot from them.  Take a class with him if at all possible because you will learn more from him than probably any other math prof at sfu.  You will not regret taking a class with him.
Gives long assignments, which are worth a large portion of your grade.  Lots of feedback on your work.
